intro: Diaphananthe lecomtei var. lecomtei, commonly known as the Lecomte's diaphananthe, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, compound leaves that are often described as having a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
